meanings.definition: The belief that a society or system should be led by a select group of individuals who are perceived as superior in intelligence, wealth, or social status.
meanings.sent1: Elitism can sometimes lead to exclusion and unfair treatment.
meanings.sent2: The country's elitism was evident in the way only the wealthy had access to certain opportunities.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the elitism of the guests was clear as they only socialized with people of a certain status.
meanings.sent4: The elitism in the academic world can create barriers for those who come from less privileged backgrounds.
meanings.sent5: Her elitism was so extreme that she refused to even acknowledge those she deemed beneath her.

meanings.definition: The practice of favoring or promoting the interests of a select group of individuals over others.
meanings.sent1: Elitism in the workplace can lead to resentment among colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The elitism of the board members was evident in their decision to only consider candidates from prestigious universities.
meanings.sent3: The elitism of the fashion industry often results in exclusive events that only a select few can attend.
meanings.sent4: The elitism in the art world can make it difficult for emerging artists to break through.
meanings.sent5: His elitism was so extreme that he refused to even consider ideas from anyone outside his inner circle.
